page.title: 09Newquay-The Town
page.content:
Newquay is situated on the North Cornwall coastline.It has developed on a linear plane along the clifftops, with Pentire at one end and St Columb Minor at the other.Most of the clifftop positions are taken by large hotels.The River Gannel borders the southern edge of the town.
Despite the concentration of shops and houses in the town centre,there are also open spaces such as the Killacourt.There is a pedestrian precinct in the main street,which means that traffic has to follow a one-way system around it.
Many of the shops are gift shops, but there are some national chain stores,such as Boots' and Woolworth's, as well as local family-owned shops.
